metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6118 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A double-eviction in the Incognito mode cache that lead to a user-after-free in cache in Google Chrome prior to 66.0.3359.139 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
chromium-browser-l10n - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
chromium-chromedriver - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3').
